summary: "One Hot Minute" is the sixth album by Red Hot Chili Peppers, released in 1995. After the success of their previous album, guitarist John Frusciante left, and Dave Navarro joined. The album has a heavier sound than their earlier work, with influences from heavy metal and psychedelic rock. Singer Anthony Kiedis wrote about the struggles of drug addiction. The album was successful, but not as much as their last one, and Navarro was later replaced by Frusciante.
title: One Hot Minute
